definition: band/belt/girdle/ribbon/tire/area/zone/region/CL:條|条[tiao2]/to wear/to carry/to take along/to bear (i.e. to have)/to lead/to bring/to look after/to raise

sentences.english: And where do I find shoelaces?
sentences.chinese: 还有我去哪儿可以找到鞋带。

sentences.english: He wore plimsolls, loosely tied with bits of string.
The shoelace has relaxed , the place also should go to a nobody has finished being.
sentences.chinese: 鞋带松了，也应走到没人的地方系好。

sentences.english: Then, real fast, I began tightening the man's shoelaces.
sentences.chinese: 说时迟，那时快，我开始系紧这个人的鞋带。

sentences.english: Attach it to a shoelace or a string, and you've got yourself a fishing line.
sentences.chinese: 把它系在鞋带或细线上，钓鱼线就大功告成了。

sentences.english: Feel free to leave your shoelaces untied, you will not fall over.
sentences.chinese: 让你的鞋带自由的散开，你也不会因此而跌倒。

sentences.english: We tie the laces in a bow.
I had to buy a new pair of laces for my tennis shoes.
sentences.chinese: 我得为我的网球鞋买双新鞋带儿。

sentences.english: But the coolest thing about your five-digit shoelaces?
sentences.chinese: 但是最酷的事情是关于这双价值5位数的鞋带？

sentences.english: Premium leather upper features faux laces grown-up appeal.
sentences.chinese: 高级人造皮革鞋面功能鞋带长大了上诉。

sentences.english: He loosed the laces of his shoes.
Lace-up closure with single hook-and-loop ankle strap to keep your laces tucked.
sentences.chinese: 关闭花边单钩环踝带，以保持你的鞋带藏。

sentences.english: Replacing slippery laces or changing your Shoelace Knot are better alternatives.
sentences.chinese: 更换滑花边或变更您的鞋带结是更好的选择。

sentences.english: After that, I lace my shoes climbing, take some chalk and to go on the first hold.
sentences.chinese: 之后我系紧鞋带，摸把镁粉开始抓第一个点。

sentences.english: Baby planted his shoe in the garden, with a new shoelace tied in a bow.
sentences.chinese: 小男孩把它的鞋种在了花园里，鞋上又穿了个新鞋带。

sentences.english: Chewed-up pieces of leather and shoelaces lay scattered all over the carpet.
sentences.chinese: 被咬得乱七八糟的碎皮革和鞋带在地毯上散了一地。

definition: to tie on/to buckle up/to fasten
a buckle or fastener for clothing that does not use a button and buttonhole (e.g. the buckle on metal wristwatches)
